qas.question: When was his sister Ancilla diagnosed with stomach cancer?
When did he send his last letter to his dying sister?
Where did he want to be buried?

answers.text: the crypt of Saint Mark's in Venice

qas.question: What was Roncalli diagnosed with in the early 1950's?

plausible_answers.text: in the crypt of Saint Mark's in Venice

qas.question: Where did Roncalli's sister want to be buried in her will?
When was one of Roncalli's predecessors buried?

context: His sister Ancilla would soon be diagnosed with <b4_0>stomach cancer<b4_0/> in <a0_0>the early 1950s<a0_0/>. Roncalli's last letter to her was dated <b7_0>on <a1_0>8 November 1953<b7_0/><a1_0/> where he promised to visit her within the next week. He could not keep that promise, as Ancilla died on <a2_0>11 November 1953<a2_0/> at the time when he was consecrating a new church in Venice. He attended her funeral back <b6_0>in his hometown<b6_0/>. In his will around this time, he mentioned that he wished to be buried <b5_0>in <a3_0>the crypt of Saint Mark's in Venice<b5_0/><a3_0/> with some of his predecessors rather than with the family in Sotto il Monte.
